document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Wang, Yalian, O’Grady, Patrick Michael, Su, Yirui & Chen, Hongwei
document.docTitle: Leucophenga delta Huang & Wang & O’Grady & Su & Chen 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VIII: twenty-one species from the Oriental region, with morphological and molecular evidence

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VIII: twenty-one species from the Oriental region, with morphological and molecular evidence

heading.emphasis:
Leucophenga delta Huang & Chen
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is most similar to
L . valvata
sp. nov.
in the having the postocellar setae minute ( Figs. 7A , 8M ), the mesonotum and scutellum entirely brownish yellow ( Figs. 7B , 8N ), the pleura lacking stripe above ( Figs. 7C , 8O ), and the wing mostly clouded ( Figs. 3D , 4E ), but can be distinguished from the latter in having the epandrium with pubescence and setae ( Fig. 27A ); surstylus rounded and pubescent ( Fig. 27A ); paramere triangular, apically acute ( Fig. 27C ); aedeagus ventrolaterally with a long process ( Fig. 27D ); see below for that species.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 27.
Leucophenga delta Huang & Chen
,
sp. nov.
, male terminalia in lateral view. A. Epandrium, surstylus, and cercus; B. Hypandrium, paramere, gonopods, and aedeagus; C. Paramere; D. Aedeagus. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type specimens.
Holotype ♂ ( SCAU , No. 128553), CHINA : Wangtianshu , Mengla , Yunnan , 21°28'N , 101°38'E , alt.
600m
,
30.ix.2011
, ex tree trunk, HW Chen
.
Paratypes : CHINA : 6♂ , 6♀ ( SCAU , Nos 128554–65), same data as holotype
;
1♂ ( SCAU , No. 128566), Wuliangshan , Jingdong , Yunnan , 24°51'N , 100°23'E , alt.
1800m
,
27.vii.2006
, ex tree trunk, T Li
;
4♂ , 3♀ ( SCAU , Nos 128567–73), Menglun , Mengla , Yunnan , 21°41'N , 101°25'E , alt.
700–780m
,
12.ix.2001 , 17.iv.2007 , 28.ix.2011
, ex tussocks, HW Chen , JJ Gao
;
4♂ , 2♀ ( SCAU , Nos 128574– 79), Guanlei , Mengla , Yunnan , 21°38'N , 101°10'E , alt.
562m
,
15.x.2012 , 20.iv.2016
, ex tree trunks, JJ Gao , J Huang , YL Wang
.

Etymology. From the Greek word “
delta
” (= triangular), referring to the shape of paramere.
